* Give your profile and group photos a makeover. Whether you want to upload a “picture worth a thousand words”, just type a few letters, or select from one of our colorful new defaults, it’s easier than ever to create the perfect photo.

• Thanks to the new animations that appear when you select, reply, send, or receive a message, even an uninspiring conversation can still be quite moving.
• Battery life is precious, so we’ve made several changes to the way notifications are handled in the app which reduces battery usage significantly on iOS 14.5+.
• Receive an unwanted message? You can now report it as spam when you tap block.

• Fixed a bug that wouldn't let you send larger images. Panorama-tastic.
• Fixed a crash for users on iOS 12
• Fixed a bug that wouldn't let you send larger images. Panorama-tastic.

• Become a conversation artist. Use the new color selector to turn every chat into a masterpiece, or let “auto” mode pick something just as palette-able.
• Once you've found the perfect disappearing message timer, why not try it out everywhere? You can now set a default timer that applies to any chats you start.

• Transcribing that welcome message every time someone joins the group starting to kill the vibe? We prescribe a new way to describe which is visible to members automatically. Feel free to ascribe those continued good vibes to us!
• Signal is a nonprofit powered by people like you. We’ve now made it easy to donate to Signal using Apple Pay. Just go to Settings > Donate to get started. Your donation helps Signal stay independent and ad-free. Thank you for standing with us!
• Curious whether your latest monologue got the attention it deserved? You can now see when someone has listened to your voice messages. If you see the dot on your voice message, it’s still waiting for a listen.  
• You can also now see when a view-once photo or video has been viewed right from message details.

* Voice notes have been given a fresh coat of paint. Consecutive messages now play together and if something interrupts your recording (like admiring our new looks), your message will be perfectly preserved in our new draft state (phew!).
* Letting go can be hard, but our new custom disappearing timer can help you find a little more time to process those fleeting messages before they're gone forever.

* We still have more improvements in the works, but the chat scrolling enhancements in this release will make you feel like such a "Smooth Operator" that you're basically performing an unofficial cover of Sade's hit song from 1984.
* Numerous bugs in chat search have vanished without a trace, and search results are better organized to make things easier to find. If you are looking for a group named "Hi" it will no longer get buried by every single message where someone said hello.
* We fixed a bug that made it impossible to find results for a single Chinese character in the new chat screen.
* Animated GIF search results now show up in a jiffy (even though that isn't how GIF is pronounced).

* Fall in love with several improvements to the media upload and download experience. It may seem like everything is happening really fast, especially when you send multiple photos and videos all at once, but love is like that sometimes. It's OK to start feeling more attached to sending more attachments.
* Love and loss are inextricably connected, so we also broke up with a bug that made it impossible to share long videos from other apps (like the iOS Photos app).
* As part of our ongoing efforts to redesign and enhance the app, we updated the chat settings screen to make common actions easier to find and to help you find common ground in one-on-one chats by displaying the groups that both of you have in common.

Interested in helping improve Signal? We're hiring. Visit https://signal.org/workworkwork to learn more.

* Give notifications in any conversation a rest (while you rest) with the new 8-hour mute setting. Or choose "Always" instead of one year, and say goodbye to the annual tradition of renewing a moment of silence.
* Swipe left on any message to quickly see message details. Whether you're wondering when the message was sent (exit stage left) or when they saw the message and didn't reply (left you on read), nothing is left to the imagination with the new left-swipe shortcut.

- Optimized for iOS 9 including important performance and reliability improvements.
- Quick Replies: reply to messages from your lock screen. (iOS 9 only)
- 3D Touch Support.
- Latest translations.

New in 2.1:
- Improved notifications - See the message details you expect without
  sacrificing any privacy. Control how much information you would like to
  be displayed. View the count of unread messages that are waiting in
  other threads from any conversation view. Swipe from the lock screen or
  tap any incoming notification to go directly to that conversation.
- Preliminary Apple Watch support!
- Better phone calls - Continuous vibration while an incoming call is
  ringing. Faster call connection speed. Missed call notifications that
  allow you to quickly dial back.
- Updated layout - The Inbox and Archive toggles have been moved to the
  top of the screen and are now easier to select.
- Enhanced speed
- Numerous bug fixes
